TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ApplicationTrustCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> objects encapsulate security decisions about an application.

Docs.permission: requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 Add(class System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust trust) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds an element to the collection.
Docs.returns: The index at which the new element was inserted.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> object is added to the end of the collection. To remove an application trust that you previously added, use the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection.Remove%2A> method.

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity%2A> property of the specified in is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddRange(class System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust[] trusts) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of type containing the objects to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Copies the elements of the specified array to the end of the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> objects contained in the `trusts` array are appended to the end of the collection.
To remove a range of application trusts that you previously added, use the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection.RemoveRange%2A> method.

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity%2A> property of an specified in is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddRange(class System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection trusts) cil managed

Docs.param: A containing the objects to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Copies the elements of the specified to the end of the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> objects contained in `trusts` are appended to the end of the collection.
You can use the AddRange method to quickly add another collection of application trust objects to the collection instead of manually adding each application trust to the collection using the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection.Add%2A> method.
To remove a range of application trusts that you previously added, use the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection.RemoveRange%2A> method.

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity%2A> property of an specified in is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all the application trusts from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Each <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> in the collection is identified by its <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity%2A> property. If the value of the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity%2A> property for any <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> object in the collection is `null`, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown.

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity%2A> property of an item in the collection is .

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust[] array, int index);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(class System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust[] array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The one-dimensional array of type that is the destination of the elements copied from the current collection.
The zero-based index in `array` at which copying begins.
Docs.summary: Copies the entire collection to a compatible one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!CAUTION] > All the application trusts in the collection are copied into the array starting at the specified index location, overwriting any existing data within the range of objects copied into the array.

Docs.exception: is less than the lower bound of .

is multidimensional.

The number of elements in the is greater than the available space from to the end of the destination .

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items contained in the collection.
Docs.value: The number of items contained in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection Find(class System.ApplicationIdentity applicationIdentity, valuetype System.Security.Policy.ApplicationVersionMatch versionMatch) cil managed

Docs.param: An object describing the application to find.
Docs.summary: Gets the application trusts in the collection that match the specified application identity.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The application trust is optionally selected by an exact version match, based on the value of the `versionMatch` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an object that can be used to iterate over the collection.
Docs.returns: An that can be used to iterate over the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustEnumerator> implements the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> interface that allows you to move within a collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to its initial position.
> [!NOTE] > After you create the enumerator, or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to reposition the enumerator to the start of the collection, you must then call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to position the enumerator to the first item. Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the object within the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets the object located at the specified index in the collection.
Docs.value: The object at the specified index in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this method to get a <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> object from the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection> at the specified index.

Docs.exception: is greater than or equal to the count of objects in the collection.

Docs.param: The full name of the application.
Docs.summary: Gets the object for the specified application.
Docs.value: The object for the specified application, or if the object cannot be found.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity%2A> property of each <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> object in the collection is examined for a <xref:System.ApplicationIdentity.FullName%2A> property value that matches the application specified by the `appFullName` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust trust) cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes the specified application trust from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The entire collection is searched, and all instances of the specified application trust are removed.
The objects that follow the removed objects move up to occupy the vacated positions. The indexes of the objects that are moved are also updated.

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity%2A> property of the object specified by is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.ApplicationIdentity applicationIdentity, valuetype System.Security.Policy.ApplicationVersionMatch versionMatch) cil managed

Docs.param: The of the object to be removed.
Docs.summary: Removes all application trust objects that match the specified criteria from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The application trust can be identified by an exact version match, dependent upon the value of the `versionMatch` parameter. The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection.Find%2A> method is used to locate all matching application trusts, and the matching items are removed from the collection.
The objects that follow the removed objects move up to occupy the vacated positions. The indexes of the objects that are moved are also updated.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveRange(class System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust[] trusts) cil managed

Docs.param: A one-dimensional array of type that contains items to be removed from the current collection.
Docs.summary: Removes the application trust objects in the specified array from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The objects that follow the removed objects move up to occupy the vacated positions. The indexes of the objects that are moved are also updated.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveRange(class System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection trusts) cil managed

Docs.param: An that contains items to be removed from the currentcollection.
Docs.summary: Removes the application trust objects in the specified collection from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The objects that follow the removed objects move up to occupy the vacated positions. The indexes of the objects that are moved are also updated.

Docs.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Docs.value: The object to use to synchronize access to the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default implementation returns the current application trust object.
